title: From hell on earth to eerie beauty: Amazing pictures of the world’s most incredible landscapes which featured in Environmental Photographer of the Year
text:
View
comments
These are some of the incredible photographs submitted to the Atkins CIWEM Environmental Photographer of the Year competition.
Over ten thousand images were submitted during this year's competition by both photographers and filmmakers from 60 different countries.
And the winner was amateur photographer Uttam Kamati's breathtaking image of a husband and wife watering watermelons on the Teesta river bed in India.
The annual international showcase highlights the very best in environmental photography and film - including both amateur and professional works - and provides photographers with an opportunity to share environmental and social issues.
By exposing international audiences to what some individuals see every day, there is a hope that it will foster widespread understanding of the causes, consequences and solutions to climate change and social inequality.
An exhibition of 111 of the entries is on display in South Kensington, London, at the Royal Geographical Society, until July 10.
Here we publish the winner along with a selection of the incredible shortlisted images that are sure to have made the judges' decision a tough one.
The Atkins CIWEM Environmental Photographer of the Year has been awarded to Uttam Kamati for his inspiring image 'Watering Melon'
The Young Environmental Photographer of the Year £1,000 prize has been awarded to Bhar Dipayan's 'Families are living under the Bridge'
 Next How theme parks make you fit: Infographic reveals how just... Paris to get first skyscraper in 40 years... but not... Penis peppers and vulva flowers: How Barcelona shops are... The Atkins Cityscape Prize, also worth £1,000, has been awarded to Michael Theodoric for his photograph, 'Enjoy'
Esme Allen has been awarded the Forestry Commission England Exhibition Award for her series entitled 'Eden Restored - The Mesopotamian Marshes of Iraq'
Runners up include this photograph of a young man in Agbobloshie, Ghana, transporting highly toxic materials to the landfill
Molay Bhadra's portrait chronicling man's walks on the moon is entitled 'Next Stop Mars The Exhotic Land'
David Cherensa submitted this photograph of thousands of deflating globes for consideration in the competition
Barun Datta's black and white image of this traditional man is entitled 'The Power of Ram'
Arnab Adak captured Holi, which is the Hindi festival of colours, signifying the victory of good over evil, in 'The Other Side of Colours'
Thousands of Muslim pilgrims make their way back to Dhaka on a train from Tongi on a very risky journey in this submission
In Spain, a photographer captured the Rapa das Bestas, in which a man frightens the horses to prevent further fighting
In 2012, Elena Barantseva captured mist shrouding the view of the Nikolo-Perervinski monastery with Cathedral of Our Lady of Iver
Rana Belai photographed a young child searching for something among scores of garbage littering the ground
In this image, Greenpeace activists represent heads of state, wearing suits and papier-mache heads in the middle of the Arctic Ocean
David Ellingsen captured this image of a lance tooth crosscut saw perched atop a tree root
Reza Golchin's image of a man looking at two different cages full of small parakeets is entitled 'Wish'
This shot of La Pepa's Bridge is particularly remarkable as it will be the tallest in Europe when construction is completed
Mike Mezeul II's breathtaking photograph of storm clouds overtaking farming fields - and a boy standing in them - is deemed 'Insignificant'
Two young girls swim through a river collecting plastic rubbish in Thu Huynh's thought-provoking photograph
Andrei Ionut's image of the interior of a rustic, dirt-floor Eastern European home is entitled 'Serbian Sad Corner'
Two women showcase all of the plastic they have collected on the shores in Amanda Jackson's image, 'The Dirty Beaches'
Shakil falls asleep on his tools after a hard day of work at an aluminum factor in Chittagong, Bangladesh
A small boy, clad in rags, is pictured looking through piles of burned garbage in Hoang Le Duy's image 'Search'
Plastic bags are part of the landscape in the Bolivian Altiplao, causing the deterioration of landscapes and agricultural soils
A man finds a new use for an old, shredded tire in Long Ly Hoang's photograph entitled, 'Old Tires Re-Used'
A worker is pictured rolling out the hose in a mining area, where water is pumped through to cool down the ceramic pipes
Fotis Milionis has captured what seems to be an abandoned home, complete with snarled, overgrown weeds in 'Rural House'
Thousands of people line the streets to pray in Joydeep Mukerjee's stunningly colourful 'Namaj and City' image
A worker is portrayed perching in a doorway in Yousuf Tushar's 'Life In The Ship Breaking Yard'
A monkey sits on top of a hanging tire in this black and white photograph from Ian Wide entitled 'In The Dark'
An employee of the Russian Space Training Centre hangs space suits out to dry on a line following a simulation
Many African cows are photographed in Kieran Doherty's photo entitled 'Cattle, South Sudan'
Four individuals look through piles of rubble, with bags in hand, in this image called 'Thanh' by Nguyen Duong
